inventory.commentary: 15Mar07 updated to wn2.1, added features. ahouston 15Mar07 - merged Sense 8 into Sense 5 .ahouston

sense.name: nexus, the place of connection
sense.examples: The esophagogastric junction is the link between the esophagus and the stomach epithelium.

sense.name: fasteners or connectors
sense.commentary: LINK[+entity][+artifact][+fastener] a fastener that serves to join or link
sense.examples: The walls are held together with metal links placed in the wet mortar during construction. John has lost his best cuff links.

sense.name: being connected, having a significant association
sense.examples: The link between church and state is inescapable. There's a strong link between that boy and his dog. Have they found a link between smoking and lung cancer? This fossil is the missing link in the evolution of that species. She has a lot of personal links to the media.

sense.name: a channel of social communication
sense.commentary: LINK[+relation][+role][+communication][+channel] contact, inter-group communication - a channel for communication between groups
sense.examples: He provided a liason with the guerrillas. The weekly mail was her only link to the outside world, beyond the remote jungle village. The blog provided a nice link to current events in the physics community.

sense.name: two way communication via electronics
sense.examples: Grown-ups call thier walkie-talkies "links". Their lab has a data link to several earth-orbiting satellites.

sense.name: unit of length
sense.commentary: LINK[+quantity][+measure][+unit][+length] a unit of length equal to 1/100 of a chain
sense.examples: It's only about 5 links long. Mary gave her dog a link of sausage. (probably extended usage)

sense.name: computer instruction
sense.commentary: LINK[+entity][+symbolic][+instruction][+computer][+connecting] an instruction that connects one part of a program or an element on a list to another program or list
sense.examples: If you write a link to the other list the program will run more quickly.

sense.name: connecting span of railway
sense.examples: They just put in a new rail link between the Cape and Boston.
